did.abstract: Member of Co. K, 339th U.S. Infantry who served in the Allied intervention in Russia, 1918-1920, the "Polar Bear Expedition." Collection includes citation from French government for bravery in combat in 1918; and photographs.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The collection was donated by Mrs. G. T. Shilson, of Lansing, Michigan, in 1966 (Donor no.: 4326).

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

prefercite.p: item, folder title, box no., Gilbert T. Shilson papers, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: Served as lieutenant, Co. K, 339th Infantry.

scopecontent.p: A photocopy of a citation for bravery from the French government and photographs taken at the ceremonies at White Chapel Memorial Park Cemetery during which the bodies of American soldiers returned from Russia were reinterred.
